intro: Epilobium kesamitsui, commonly known as the Taiwan willow herb, is a herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with specific ecological requirements.
